SEARCH
Package com.example.myapplication.data.repo

Interface EventRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
FirebaseEventRepository
public interface EventRepository
EventRepository defines the contract for managing event-related operations within the application’s data layer.

This repository serves as an abstraction over the underlying data source (e.g. Firebase Firestore), ensuring a clean separation between the app’s business logic and data storage implementation.

Implementations of this interface (such as FirebaseEventRepository) handle all network or database operations for creating and updating event data.

    Description

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      void createEvent(Context context, UserEvent event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      Creates a new event and uploads it to the backend database.

      The implementation is expected to:

      • Generate a unique document ID for the event.
      • Upload associated poster images or files if provided.
      • Store the UserEvent object in Firestore or another data source.
      Parameters:
      context - the current Context, used for Firebase or repository access
      event - the UserEvent object containing event details
      onSuccess - callback triggered when the event is successfully created
      onFailure - callback triggered when the event creation fails

    • updateEvent

      void updateEvent(String eventId, UserEvent event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccess, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailure)
      Updates an existing event’s data in the backend.

      The implementation should locate the event document using eventId and apply any modified fields from the provided UserEvent object.

      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique identifier of the event to be updated
      event - the updated UserEvent object with new field values
      onSuccess - callback triggered when the event update operation succeeds
      onFailure - callback triggered if the update operation fails
